required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Acute Exercise Intensity on Cerebral Blood Flow and Cognitive Function in Older Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Acute Exercise Intensity on Cerebral Blood Flow and Cognitive Function in Older Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This study will analyze the influence of acute bout exercise intensities (continuous moderate and HIIT) on middle cerebral artery velocity (MCAv) to identify which intensity elicits the greatest increase in CBF in older adults (65+ yrs). Additionally, this study will help verify positive correlations between MCAv and cognitive function. These findings are important in determining the optimal exercise prescription for increased resilience against the cognitive degradation associated with Dementia and Alzheimer's Disease.

detailed_description.textblock:
Previous research has investigated the active impact of continuous exercise of various intensities on cerebral blood flow (CBF), but no such attempts have been made to study the effects of high intensity interval training (HIIT) despite its associations with increased shear stress and greater nitric oxide (NO) mediated vasodilation. Therefore, the primary goal of this study is to analyze the acute influence of HIIT on middle cerebral artery velocity (MCAv) to help identify the exercise intensity that elicits the greatest increase in overall CBF.
Furthermore, there are few human studies that have examined the effects of increased CBF on cognitive function despite evidence that they are positive correlated. Thus, the secondary goal of this study would be to verify positive associations between MCAv and cognitive function in older human subjects.
Utilizing a cycle ergometer, each subject will complete an initial Cardiopulmonary Exercise Test (CPET) to identify exercise risk as well as potential individual exercise intensity ranges. Given subjects don't meet the criteria for excessive risk, this initial visit will be followed by three randomized experimental sessions: the control session and two Kcal work-matched exercise visits of either continuous moderate intensity or HIIT. The control session will consist of lying down on a flat surface instead of cycling to get baseline variable measures. Conversely, the two exercise visits will have the subjects exercise at LT for the moderate intensity session as well as alternating between 85% and 45% of VO2max in a 1:1 interval ratio for the HIIT session. During all three of these experimental sessions, subjects' real-time MCAv, cerebral O2 saturation, PaCO2, heart rate (HR), and MAP will be measured continuously using Transcranial Doppler Sonography (TCD), Near infrared Spectroscopy (NIRS), Capnograph, ECG, and Finger photoplethysmography (FP), respectively. Additionally, Augmentation Index (AI) and Pulse Wave Velocity (PWV) via Pulse Wave Analysis (PWA), working memory via the n-back test (2-back), BDNF and VEGF via blood samples, and Internal Carotid Artery Blood Flow (ICA-BF) via Doppler Ultrasound will be measured before and after each cycling/lying bout. Pre-measures will be taken once right before exercise, but post-measures will be repeated three times. Each round of post-measurements will take place 15min apart to capture how the variables of interest change over time during the recovery period.
It is hypothesized that the acute HIIT bout will result in the greatest overall (over the course of the session) increase in MCAv, specifically in the post-exercise period. Subsequently, this increase is hypothesized to correlate with increases in cognitive function as shown by improvement on the n-back test. These findings are specifically important in terms of determining whether exercise can serve as a tool to protect against cognitive degradation and, if so, finding what specific exercise prescription can optimize these effects. Depending on results, the hope would be to then extend this current experiment into a longitudinal follow- up study with Alzheimer's patients to examine whether HIIT could potentially slow or even mitigate degenerative Alzheimer's Disease symptoms such as memory loss.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is a repeated measures cross-over design, in which all subjects will complete all acute exercise intensity conditions: HIIT, continuous moderate intensity at lactate threshold (LT), and rest (control). The order of the acute treatment bouts will be randomized for each subject over three experimental visits (not counting the screening visit).
study_design_info.masking_description: The individual analyzing study data will be blind to subject allocation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously over the course of each experimental session (i.e. 2-3 hours)
primary_outcome.description: Blood flow velocity measured in the Middle Cerebral Artery via Transcranial Doppler probe secured to the right temporal window.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 individual measurements taken during each experimental session with each session lasting up to about 3 hours. 1 pre-intervention measurement and 3 post-intervention measurements spaced at least 15min apart
secondary_outcome.description: Measured via n-back test (2-back); Subject's will be presented a sequence of letters (25 of them from a base set of 15 letters) one-by-one and will have 3 seconds to indicate whether the letter they see currently matches the letter from 2 frames ago. If there is no match, then they do not need to respond.They will complete three rounds each with a different sequence. Accuracy score (%) = correct inputs/# of stimuli, averaged across 3 blocks.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously over the course of each experimental session (i.e. 2-3 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured via Near-Infrared Spectroscopy secured on the forehead (pre-frontal Cortex); records relative amounts of oxygenated and deoxygenated hemoglobin as well as the total amount circulating in the measurement region.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 individual measurements taken during each experimental session with each session lasting up to about 3 hours. 1 pre-intervention measurement and 2 post-intervention measurements spaced at least 15min apart
secondary_outcome.description: Via single stick 0.05ml blood draw and analyzed via Luminex MAGPIX (ThermoFisher Scientific device) after processing/treatment (After being treated with heparin and centrifuged to separate red blood cells (RBCs) and plasma, will be snap frozen with liquid nitrogen).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 individual measurements taken during each experimental session with each session lasting up to about 3 hours. 1 pre-intervention measurement and 2 post-intervention measurements spaced at least 15 min apart
secondary_outcome.description: Via single stick 0.05ml blood draw and analyzed via Luminex MAGPIX (ThermoFisher Scientific device) after processing/treatment (After being treated with heparin and centrifuged to separate red blood cells (RBCs) and plasma, will be snap frozen with liquid nitrogen).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 individual measurements taken during each experimental session with each session lasting up to about 3 hours. 1 pre-intervention measurement and 3 post-intervention measurements spaced at least 15min apart
secondary_outcome.description: Measured via Ultrasound; diameter will be measured as the peak of the pulse wave

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 individual measurements taken during each experimental session with each session lasting up to about 3 hours. 1 pre-intervention measurement and 3 post-intervention measurements spaced at least 15min apart
secondary_outcome.description: Measured via Ultrasound; velocity will be assessed at the peak of each pulse wave

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously over the course of each experimental session (i.e. 2-3 hours)
Measured continuously over the course of each experimental session (i.e. 2-3 hours)
other_outcome.description: Measured via Capnograph; connected nasal cannulas are placed in the nostrils and respiration will be assessed continuously

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously over the course of each experimental session (i.e. 2-3 hours)
other_outcome.description: Measured via Finger photoplethysmography (Non-Invasive Blood Pressure; NIBP), pressure cuffs on the subjects fingers will take continual blood pressure readings via continual inflation and deflation

other_outcome.time_frame: 4 individual measurements taken during each experimental session with each session lasting up to about 3 hours. 1 pre-intervention measurement and 3 post-intervention measurements spaced at least 15min apart
other_outcome.description: Measured via Pulse Wave Analysis; a SphygmoCor device probe will be held on carotid artery and pulse wave will be analyzed

other_outcome.time_frame: 4 individual measurements taken during each experimental session with each session lasting up to about 3 hours. 1 pre-intervention measurement and 3 post-intervention measurements spaced at least 15min apart
other_outcome.description: Measured via SphygmoCor; distances between brachial artery and femoral artery will be taken for calibration, cuffs at the brachial and femoral arteries will inflate and SphygmoCor will take pulse wave measurements

other_outcome.time_frame: 4 individual measurements taken during each experimental session with each session lasting up to about 3 hours. 1 pre-intervention measurement and 3 post-intervention measurements spaced at least 15min apart
other_outcome.description: Measured via Ultrasound; diameter will be measured during both systole and diastole

arm_group.arm_group_label: Acute bout of Continuous Moderate Intensity Exercise
Acute bout of High Intensity Interval Training (HIIT)

intervention.intervention_name: Acute bout of Continuous Moderate Intensity Exercise
intervention.description: In this experimental intervention subjects will cycle continuously at moderate intensity (VO2 corresponding to lactate threshold) until a 200 kcal equivalent energy expenditure is reached.
intervention.arm_group_label: Acute bout of Continuous Moderate Intensity Exercise

intervention.intervention_name: Acute bout of High Intensity Interval Training
intervention.description: In this experimental invention subjects will alternate between 1 minute of high intensity cycling (watts corresponding to 85% VO2peak) and 1 minute of low intensity cycling (watts corresponding to 45% VO2peak) until a 200 kcal equivalent energy expenditure is reached.
intervention.arm_group_label: Acute bout of High Intensity Interval Training (HIIT)

intervention.description: In this intervention placebo, subjects will lay down on a flat, soft surface for 30 minutes in a dimly light room. They will not be allowed to use any electronic devices or read during this time to avoid potentially influencing continuous data recording.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 65+ years of age
- Comfortable with experiencing exercise-induced fatigue
- Willingness and ability to comply with scheduled visits and study procedures
- Able to provide consent on their own behalf
- Type 2 Diabetics accepted
Exclusion Criteria:
- Competitive athlete (Recreationally active is okay but no more than 3 days/week of structured exercise)
- VO2max below 18 ml/kg/min in men, 15ml/kg/min in women (minimum thresholds for independent living seniors)
- Inability of study staff to acquire signal from the MCA using TCD
- Diagnosis of mild cognitive impairment, Parkinson's Disease, Alzheimer's Disease, multiple sclerosis, or psychiatric illness (unless mild depression or anxiety)
- History of brain damage/stroke/concussions
- Cardiovascular Disease, Pulmonary Disease, or dependence of supplemental O2
- Type 2 Diabetics who aren't cleared by the study physician during the first screening visit (HbA1C > 8.5%)
- Neuromuscular or musculoskeletal dysfunctions impairing one from cycling
- Changes in vasoactive medication dose or quantity, recently prior to or during the study time course, or inability to maintain regular timed ingestion of vasoactive medication
- Currently involved in Estrogen or Testosterone Replacement Therapy
- Unable to abstain from food consumption (3hrs), caffeine/alcohol consumption (12hrs), and vigorous exercise (24hrs) prior to experimental procedures
